body: @sebastianbergmann do you need any help with this?
Yes, a pull request would help. Thank you!

@sebastianbergmann I've checked again and all branches are now passing w/ latest PHP master on my CI too: https://github.com/mbeccati/php-latest-builds/actions/runs/17005556973

What kind of problems were you referring to?

We currently test all branches (`8.5`, `9.6`, `10.5`, `11.5`, `12.3`, `main`) for every push. But we only test `main` every night (even when there was no push). I would like to have the same for the other branches as well.

issue.title: Add nightly build for active branches

labels.name: type/enhancement
labels.description: A new idea that should be implemented

labels.name: type/build-automation
labels.description: Issues related to PHPUnit's build automation (GitHub Actions, etc.)

issue.body:
As you might know, scheduling only works on the default branch, and allowing other branches is still just a requested feature: https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions/16107

I've borrowed some code from my nightly builds project and set up a separate workflow to be run on a schedule or manually.

I've created a teporary copy of the repo in order to test this and here's the result: https://github.com/mbeccati/phpunit-tmp/actions/runs/17032424357/job/48277701118

Hope this helps!

Fixes #6305

issue.title: Added missing dependency to randomly failing test

labels.name: type/tests
labels.description: Tests! Yes, PHPUnit, too, needs tests.

issue.body:
The test randomly fails on the nightly build: https://github.com/mbeccati/phpunit-tmp/actions/runs/17169819499/job/48717189409 due to `--order-by depends,random` and a missing dependency.

Only applies to 8.5 and 9.6 as far as I can tell.

Refs #6305

issue.title: Fix test that was passing only when run sequentially
